text: The Canada lynx is a species of lynx which lives on the taiga. It is about twice the size of a domestic cat. It eats mice, ground squirrels, lemming and young deer. The lynx's favorite food is the snowshoe hare, which makes up 60% to 97% of its diet. This wild animal is not endangered (except in the southern 48 states of the US). It is of "least concern" (IUCN). Humans hunt them for their beautiful, thick fur. It has tufts on its ears whose function is probably social signalling. ==References== Category:Felines Category:Mammals of North America
title: Canada lynx
